t: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.
Lord,*sp how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.
Many*p there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.
But*p thou, O Lord,*s art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
I*p cried unto the Lord*s with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.
I*p laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the Lord*s sustained me.
I*p will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.
Arise,*p O Lord;*s save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
Salvation*p belongeth unto the Lord:*s thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
